item.description:
I am posting this since I think many of you would find this interesting - if you are in the area I am sure it will be a wonderful event.

Use the RSVP process and comments section below to communicate with other randomites that might be participating this event.

=====

Bill Irwin, with his Seeing Eye dog Orient, is the only blind person to have completed the 2,168 mile Appalachian Trail. His historic hike began in Georgia and ended almost nine months later in north central Maine. This amazing odyssey was the single most publicized human endeavor that year, and an inspiring example of overcoming the odds for all!

Bill's book Blind Courage, the account of Bill's lifetime of overcoming the odds and his incredible journey, was released nationally in 1992, now in its thirteenth printing, and has been a best seller. He has appeared on television programs such as" The Morning Show" on NBC, "Sonya Live" on CNN, "Heart to Heart" on CBN. He is the subject and cover of many magazines. Blind Courage is published in the United Kingdom, Germany, and Taiwan.

Bill will have his Seeing Eye dog with him, and copies of his book, “Blind Courage,” will be available for purchase.

A reception follows the program.

There is no charge for this unique and inspirational presentation but any donations will be more gratefully accepted.

Seating is limited – call (207) 772-7241 to reserve your seats, to get directions, or ask any questions.

Location:

Trinity Episcopal Church
580 Forest Avenue
Portland, ME 04101

For more information about Bill and his experiences visit his web site:

http://www.billirwin.com
item.name: An evening with Bill Irwin - the only blind person to hike the entire AT
